item.title: Why should you be a T-Shaped engineer ?
item.description: Being a software engineer in 2022 is demanding. On one side, you have to know more and more technologies and tools. On the other, you need to have a depth of knowledge about the stack you are using daily. We need to find a way to combine those two aspects without neglecting one of the two. And the way is to become a T-shaped engineer.

item.title: Build a Spring Boot REST API with Full-Text Search using Hibernate Search
item.description: Search is one of the pillars of the web, and full-text search is one of the mandatory features that every website needs. item.title: Build a paginated list in React with SWR and Styled Components
item.description: In a previous blog post, we have learned how to build an API with pagination. In this blog post, we are focusing on how to consume such an API by building a paginated list using React, the most popular javascript frontend framework at the moment.

item.title: Build a .jar file inside a Docker container with Maven
item.description: Containers have become very popular during the last few years thanks to the rise of Docker. The most common use case is to run an application in isolation, be it in a development environment or a production environment. But it can also be used for more specific use cases. In this article, we are going to build a jar file inside a docker container.

item.title: Build a Spring Boot REST API with Pagination and Sorting
item.description: Pagination is an important feature for REST API, and is used for many use cases where we want to fetch only a small part of an entire dataset. It might be for performance reasons, and fetch only the data needed at that time. It can also be used by the frontend to display items using a paginated view type of UI such as infinite scrolling.

item.title: How to set up Keycloak with Docker and PostgreSQL
item.description: In this blog post, we are going to learn how to run Keycloak inside docker, using a dedicated PostgreSQL database also running in a docker container.

item.title: Asking questions as a software engineer
item.description: It has been 6 months since I have started my internship at Lyra Network as a software engineer, and 3 months since my internship turned into a real software engineering job. During this period, you are expected to know little or nothing about the job, and thus, asking questions is mandatory. I would like to share some hints that I have picked up during this period.
